alert.note: Alert for Northern Coos; Northern Grafton; Southern Coos (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 23 at 3:20AM EST until December 23 at 12:00PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON EST TODAY... * WHAT...Wet snow and light freezing rain. Total snow accumulations between 2 and 4 inches and ice accumulations around a trace. Snow accumulations around 6 inches possible at higher elevations. * WHERE...Portions of west central and western Maine. Portions of northern New Hampshire. * WHEN...Until Noon EST today. * IMPACTS...The combination of heavy wet snow and gusty winds will lead to snapped branches and downed trees. Widespread to numerous power outages likely. Even light snowfall amounts can accumulate on roads and cause dangerous driving conditions due to snow covered roads. The hazardous conditions could impact the Friday morning commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by going to newengland511.org

area.areaDesc: Northern Coos; Northern Grafton; Southern Coos
